revised_title: Characterization of Recursively Enumerable Subsets of Finitely Generated Free Groups
tldr: The article provides a characterization of the finitely generated subgroups of finitely presented groups. It demonstrates that a finitely generated group can be embedded in a finitely presented group if and only if it has a recursively enumerable set of defining relations. This theorem offers a better understanding of the relationship between recursively presented groups and finitely presented groups.
